DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Initiation Disease or Disorder Development Timespan Interval
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the period of time between the act of starting an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process and the process that involves and promote formation of any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Initiation Disease or Disorder Development Timespan
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI)_The period of time between two dates or events or between the beginning and end of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Initiation Disease or Disorder Development Timespan
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI):The period of time between two dates or events or between the beginning and end of something.

Concepts.definition: The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI)
The period of time between two dates or events or between the beginning and end of something.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The period of time between two dates or events or between the beginning and end of something._The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 11 and less than 13 and the quantity that it denotes.: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 11 and less than 13 and the quantity that it denotes.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
